class.name: DummyScope
class.javadoc: This class is used to provide enclosing scopes for top level classes. We cannot use <tt>null</tt> to represent such a scope, since the enclosing scope is computed lazily, and so the field storing it is null until it has been computed. Therefore, <tt>null</tt> is reserved to represent an as-yet-uncomputed scope, and cannot be used for any other kind of scope.
Factory method. Enforces the singleton pattern - only one instance of this class ever exists.

Lookup a type variable in the scope, using its name. Always returns <tt>null</tt>.
name - the name of the type variable being looked up
null
